title: How to create a professional resume

sections.heading: Choose the right format
sections.content: Chronological, functional, and combination resume formats are explained with their intended use cases.

sections.heading: Include your name and contact information
sections.content: Start your resume with your name, email, phone number, and optionally a link to your portfolio.

sections.heading: Tailor your resume for each position
sections.content: Customize the skills, professional history, and education sections based on each job application.

sections.heading: Add a resume summary or objective
sections.content: Include a brief summary or career objective depending on your experience level.

sections.heading: List your soft and hard skills
sections.content: Highlight skills relevant to the job, prioritizing those listed in the job description.

sections.heading: Detail your professional history
sections.content: List work experience in reverse-chronological order and use quantifiable achievements with action verbs.

sections.heading: Include an education section
sections.content: Mention your degree, GPA, coursework, and certifications relevant to the position.

sections.heading: Consider adding optional sections
sections.content: Use achievements or interests to supplement a short resume if they align with job goals.

sections.heading: Proofread your resume
sections.content: Check for grammar and formatting errors, and consolidate where possible to fit the resume onto one or two pages.

sections.heading: Resume example
sections.content: Includes a sample resume for a graphic designer using the combination format.
